connector.description: IEC 60870 supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) server using NeoSCADA implementation.

camel.sink.endpoint.filterNonExecute.name: camel.sink.endpoint.filterNonExecute
camel.sink.endpoint.filterNonExecute.description: Filter out all requests which don't have the execute bit set

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.adsuAddressType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.adsuAddressType
camel.sink.endpoint.adsuAddressType.description: The common ASDU address size. May be either SIZE_1 or SIZE_2. One of: [SIZE_1] [SIZE_2]

camel.sink.endpoint.causeOfTransmissionT.name: camel.sink.endpoint.causeOfTransmissionType
camel.sink.endpoint.causeOfTransmissionT.description: The cause of transmission type. May be either SIZE_1 or SIZE_2. One of: [SIZE_1] [SIZE_2]

camel.sink.endpoint.informationObjectAdd.name: camel.sink.endpoint.informationObjectAddressType
camel.sink.endpoint.informationObjectAdd.description: The information address size. May be either SIZE_1, SIZE_2 or SIZE_3. One of: [SIZE_1] [SIZE_2] [SIZE_3]

camel.sink.endpoint.maxUnacknowledged.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxUnacknowledged
camel.sink.endpoint.maxUnacknowledged.description: Parameter K - Maximum number of un-acknowledged messages.

camel.sink.endpoint.causeSourceAddress.name: camel.sink.endpoint.causeSourceAddress
camel.sink.endpoint.causeSourceAddress.description: Whether to include the source address

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: Timeout in millis to wait for client to establish a connected connection.

camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreBackgroundScan.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreBackgroundScan
camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreBackgroundScan.description: Whether background scan transmissions should be ignored.

camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreDaylightSaving.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreDaylightSavingTime
camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreDaylightSaving.description: Whether to ignore or respect DST

camel.sink.endpoint.timeZone.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeZone
camel.sink.endpoint.timeZone.description: The timezone to use. May be any Java time zone string

camel.component.iec60870-server.lazyStar.name: camel.component.iec60870-server.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.iec60870-server.lazyStar.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.iec60870-server.autowire.name: camel.component.iec60870-server.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.iec60870-server.autowire.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
